About This Site

This is version 4.0 of my web site. It is based upon the Astro framework with the Tailwind CSS integration.

Version 3.0 used Middleman with a WordPress blog bolted on. Middleman has served me well, but it’s starting to feel obsolete. WordPress, being a wildly successful framework, needs constant upgrading to fend off the hackers. Also, content editing has changed, and using it seems a bit klugy.

Astro is well integrated with Visual Studio Code, so I’m working with that IDE now. It’s too “mouse-centric”, but adding the VSCode Neovim extension makes it tolerable. The integration with Netlify is pretty cool.

The site theme is based upon Nordlys, created by FjellOverflow. It’s a pretty amazing example of an Astro project. I’m humbled…

About My Blog

My WordPress blog goes back to 2009, with a total of 142 posts. It’s a manual process to convert each entry into an Astro-based blog, so this will take some time. I’ll probably send the trivial and obsolete entries to /dev/null along the way.

Blog content varies. You could look in the tags page to view the various subjects on my radar.

I don’t do Blog Comments. I already spend too much time on the computer, and adding online time for viewing and responding to comments or feedback would probably land me in divorce court. If you see anything interesting, please feel free to contact me.

About Me

Version 3.0 was more or less a professional biography with lots of travel pictures thrown into the mix. As I’m now retired, I haven’t decided what the non-blog content will entail going forward.

My Manifesto 1

I believe that the rights of the individual are more important than the goals of the collective.

I believe that the biggest impediment to human progress is always The State.

I believe in the Golden Rule.

I believe that it is better to tell the truth than a lie. I believe it is better to be free than to be a slave. And I believe it is better to know than to be ignorant.

H. L. Mencken
